intro: Dupatya ramosa, commonly known as the hairy mallow, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Dupatya ramosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
